experience: You and Stephen both know Paul Dyksterhouse, Steve McVey, and 5 others
Managing from inception, a project to transition external clients from one application platform to another.

Managed a geographically dispersed team of developers and analysts through all phases of the Project Development Lifecycle; Managed all phases of the global deployment of a Project Control application; Successfully negotiated Master Services Agreements with offshore consulting companies; Recruited and maintained an offshore development team; Primary interface with offshore management and consulting companies; Conducted regularly scheduled Client Satisfaction Surveys with Project Sponsors; Presented monthly Project Reviews to IT Senior Management; Company interface to Microsoft for Development products; Evaluated vendors and software for proposed projects

Visa operates the world’s largest and most sophisticated retail electronic payments network and is one of the mostrecognized global financial services brands.My experience at Visa consisted of the following:Service Director, BackOffice Systems* Defined and managed development and enhancement projects  * Managed successful implementation of project interfacing  web applications * Managed issue tracking, escalation and resolution* Created and executed User Acceptance Test Plans for projects* Developed End User training documents  Director, BackOffice Applications Development * Planned and managed workload, established team priorities, deliverables and schedules for team of programmers and analysts* Managed development and enhancement projects  of BackOffice and Image retrieval applications  Project Lead, BackOffice Applications Development, * Led team of programmers and analysts involved in multiple concurrent projects spanning all activities related to support and enhancement of applications* Coordinated bi-yearly releases of application software
Assisted in the set up of a Business Solution Center; Managed application outsourcing proof of concept

Started work at First First Interstate Bank in 1980 as a programmer/analyst.  Progressed as a Project Lead, Project Manager and Department (Group) Manager through my career.My career began in Los Angeles, CA; moved to Portland, OR then to Phoenix, AZ.  My last position was with Wells Fargo in Tempe, AZ.  In that position, I managed implementations and application tuning in a Call Center environment.

I worked with Steve for over a year at American Express.  In my experience, Steve was an great project facilitator and coordinator.  He was organized and constantly on top of commitments and the timelines associated to them.  Steve was not the command and control type.  He was very professional and did a great job of developing positive working relationships with all members of the project team.  This resulted in a level of respect and trust that motivated all team members to deliver on their commitments without creating a negative work environment.  Steve also did a great job at communicating the status of the projects and key success metrics in an organized and consistent manner.  This helped to ensure everyone was always on the same page.

summary: I'm an Information Technology professional with expertise in managing both technical resources and projects.  I have experience managing domestic as well as off-shore resources.  I have also managed projects to on-time and on-budget implementations.  In my most recent role, I managed a geographically dispersed group implementing projects for a global corporation.My goal is to obtain a position where I can demonstrate my management skills with both resources and projects.Specialties: Project ManagementManagement of Development and Support GroupsOn-line, Client/Server and Web based applicationsCustomer/Client InterfaceCritical Problem Solving and AnalysisBudgeting and ForecastingVendor RelationsPolicy/Procedure DevelopmentOffshore Resourcing and ManagementWritten/Oral Communication Skills
